content: Suppose you have a list of numbers [3, 6, 12, 21] stored in an Excel table. What formula can you use to calculate the average of these numbers in the table?

To calculate the average of a list of numbers in an Excel table, you can use the `AVERAGE` function. Assuming that your numbers [3, 6, 12, 21] are stored in cells A1 to A4, you can use the following formula in another cell:

```excel
=AVERAGE(A1:A4)
```

This formula will calculate the average of the numbers in the range A1 to A4.
